Posts.Content: Hi Jazzshampoo1 I have not started Letrozole yet but I have had that thought myself. My BCN told me that I know my own body best!!! but If I am numb how can I locate any bumps etc?xx
Posts.Title: How are you supposed to know

Posts.Content: Hi all I am 8 weeks post MX and 31 lymph removal, the sensations you are feeling in your arm/pit are quite normal, I experienced them as well, sudden sharp pains, stabbing and throbbing, this  is your nerves repairing themselves. My BCN told me this was quite normal, also my skin was very tender to touch, thankfully this has stopped, are you doing your exercises 3 times a day? apparently this is a must to regain full movement in the affected arm. Well done with stopping the smoking, how are you feeling without the nicotine ? I am an ex smoker, but I miss them so much.
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: HI I am using an electronic cig, even though the docs tell me that is still no good for me, they don't know what its like to stop doing something you have done for 30 years. I know what you mean about the menopause, another hurdle that we will overcome, we are very strong us women, and we can do it, but its a bloody hard slog, its a good job that we are the stronger sex !!!! When do you start your rads ?
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Morning  All I  started another type of chemo on Wednesday ( Paclitaxel )  which up to now I have been ok !!!. My question is, do I need to be having an injection the following day? my previous chemo ( Ac and Tax ) a district nurse came to my home to inject me, thank you in advance, Dendy xxx
Posts.Title: Paclitaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Tabby Cat Lover I am currently on Paclitaxel, my last session is on Wed,  12 weekly sessions. For me it has not been too bad, better than AC and TAX. The side effects for me have been mild, sore eyes, sore mouth, pins and needles in my hand and feet, but my GP has given me prescriptions to sort them out, as the weeks have gone on I have felt very tired, so i just put my feet up....... but everybody reacts differently, hope this helps a little, xxxx
Posts.Title: Paclitaxel

Posts.Content: Hi all. Feeling really down today as I am at home on my own and have loads of things running around my haggled brain. I saw my oncologist on Friday and he told me I am to have 12 more rounds of chemo and then a month of radiotherapy which is what I expected, he also told me that I have a high risk of the cancer coming back, this threw me a little and it was wasn't till I  came home that the words sank in. My question is, if I have had a mastectomy and 31 lymph nodes removed, how can the cancer come back? and where would it come back? I was feeling positive, but now I am very worried, please can anyone make me feel better, thanks xxx
Posts.Title: reacurrance

Posts.Content: Hi Chrissie I know how you feel, I had a mastectomy just over two weeks ago, I was terrified, I was more worried about the op than I was with the cancer!!! I cannot stop you worrying but it was not as bad I thought, I was not in pain, more  discomfort and relief. My op was at 1.00 pm and when I came around there was a friendly face to greet me. I was kept in overnight as I ask to, and was discharged the next day with pain relief ( I only used them for one day). Fill your fridge with your favourite things and let your Hubby look after you xxxxxx Please remember why you are having the Op.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J Hope you can help I have had 3 chemo (last one 7 weeks ago ) a mastectomy 18 days ago, next chemo in 2 weeks ish, I am having terrible trouble with my eyes, they run all the time and leave a crusty mess. I have been to my GP who gave me artificial tears !! but this has not helped, has this happened to anyone else. Thank You xxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi Chrissie How are you feeling today? Hope your drains were removed without any problems. Glad to see that you felt well enough yesterday to post a blog. Its rather a shock to see yourself with only one breast isn't it? but it was prob for the best the bugger had to go. Onwards and upwards. Take Care. xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi G n' J just a quick thank you for the useful links you keep posting Dendy xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Good Morning all I am looking for advice/help or information on a prosthetic boobie, my appt is in a few weeks and I was wondering is there is anything I should know before my apt, thanks. Dendy xx
Posts.Title: prosthetic breast

Posts.Content: HI Mary - Ann Go with the tears it is very natural, I cry most days and I feel better afterwards. I started with more chemo yesterday( my mastectomy 4 weeks ago) It wasn't pleasant but very strangely I felt better because I realised that I needed it to get me right. Everybody on this site is here to support you, scream and shout, we are here for you. Dendy xxx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: HI Mary - Ann Go with the tears it is very natural, I cry most days and I feel better afterwards. I started with more chemo yesterday( my mastectomy 4 weeks ago) It wasn't pleasant but very strangely I felt better because I realised that I needed it to get me right. Everybody on this site is here to support you, scream and shout, we are here for you. Dendy xxx
Posts.Title: not having a good day :(

Posts.Content: Hi Kate Good to hear your arm is ok now, bet you panicked. Have you had a mastectomy and chemo? How many of your nodes were affected? I have just spoken to my BCN and she informed me that I am to have more chemo followed by radiotherapy. I asked if radiotherapy would increase my chances of getting Lymphoedema she said NO because RAD would not be directed under my arm, it would be directed around my shoulder and collar bone, that put my mind at rest for the time being. Take Care xx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi tej0362 Thank you for replying, I am new to the site, please advise how to Private message you. Cheers Dendy xxx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Avril My BCN has told me to use unperfumed soap, shower gel, body cream and use an electric razor for my underarm, please can you recommend any of the above. At the moment I am obsessed with Lymphoedema, and I know I am worrying about it too much, maybe because it is early days. Is there a time scale when the swelling and tenderness reduces? Even wearing loose clothes feel like they are chaffing my underarm. Thank you to everyone who replies. Dendy xx
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Avi1766  I am new to this site so if I ask daft questions I am sorry. I had a Mastectomy 2 weeks ago and had 30 lymph nodes removed, still very sore and feeling sorry for myself. You mentioned the dreaded Lympoedema, i have a list of questions about it, I was wondering if you could help me please, thanks.
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi Denise How right you are. I like to read about positive outcomes, as is does give me hope. One thing I have , realised is that each case is individual, as we know there are many grades/types of BC and I like to have as much info as possible, so reading about other peoples journey is a great help to me. xx
Posts.Title: Positive outcomes ...
